medical_history.chief_complaint: Diagnosis and treatment of congenital aromatase deficiency.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 16 years and 4 months, with genetic analysis confirming the diagnosis. Physical examination revealed no abnormalities. At age 17 years and 1 month, treatment with estradiol valerate was initiated, which led to an increase in height by 8.5% over 41 months, and maturation of bone age from 12 years and 5 months to 16 years and 8 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital hearing loss of 85%; present in his adult brother and a paternal cousin.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's sister also presented with pubertal failure and congenital aromatase deficiency; both parents are first cousins.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not use any medication, alcohol, or drugs; he had a sedentary lifestyle due to hearing impairment.
